page.title: 10FARMING - Lydham/ More
page.content: {STOCK}SHEEP:Breeds include Welsh, Welsh Half-breds, Suffolks, Mules and Beulahs. Those on high ground eligible for Â£6.25 subsidy, lambing March-May averaging one lamb per ewe.Those on lower ground, some winter- housed, lambing Jan-March averaging 1 and 3/4 lambs per ewe. Young Breeding Ewe Â£70, Fat Lambs Â£40, Fleeces Â£6.{CATTLE: Suckler Cows, Hereford X Friesian with Charolais or Limousin calves. Subsidy on hill ground is Â£69.24 per cow. Price of cow and month old calf Â£500. Dairy British Friesian and Holstien. All milk sold to and collected by Milk Marketing Board tanker for 14p per litre. Beef- Hereford, Hereford X Friesian, Charolais and Limousin grazed out, with some in-wintering. Friesian Bulls kept inside in pens of 10/20 fed year round silage and corn. Sold fat at 15 months,at 105p per kg.
